requirement.topic: Published messages in PtP mode can be queued by xmlBlaster if the receiver is not logged in
requirement.description: If you publish a message in PtP mode and the receiver is not online, you get an exception by default. If the <ForceQueuing> flag is set in the publishing qos, the messages are queued by xmlBlaster. As soon as the receiver logs in, all queued messages are flushed to the recevier. NOTE 1: The qualifier attributes from 'engine.qos.subscribe.OfflineQueuing' may be appropriate here as well (should we rename this tag to <OfflineQueing> as well?) NOTE 2: The login qos may disallow PtP messages, ForceQueing will be ignored then.
requirement.example: <qos> <destination queryType='EXACT'> Michelle <ForceQueuing /> <!-- If the destination client is not logged in, queue the messages -> </destination> <!-- Default is no queuing --> </qos>
requirement.author: ruff@swand.lake.de
